results.title: Une Nuit a L'opera
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Stephane is locked up on the roof of the Opera House with the real jewels still in his bag. After owning up to Morales, he is forced to return to the Opera and make a second attempt of substitution under the watchful eye of Lulu, Morales’ accomplice. As they reach the dressing rooms, they are interrupted by a night watchman doing his round.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: C'est Jeudi, Jacinthe!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Lulu and Stephane have managed to swap the last jewels in Olympe’s (the star of the ballet) dressing room. When she arrives at 8 am to pick up her luggage before going to the airport, she discovers the night watchman tied up in the shower. She immediately sounds the alert. Meanwhile, Lulu and Stephane are still trying to find a way out of the Opera House. When they do so, they bump into Jacinthe who recognises the bag from the previous night.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Le Nouveau Monde
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
On arrival in Canada, Olympe arouses suspiscion from the Canadian Customs. Stephane is considering abadonning Morales and his plans, but the threat to compromise Olympe with the smuggling of stolen goods is enough to keep him going. Lulu is still trying, not so subtly, to snatch the necklace from the children,

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Equilibrium: the limit of disorder
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Defines equilibrium as a state of balance between the conflicting requirements for minimum internal energy and maximum entropy of a system and shows that free energy is at a minimum in the condition of equilibrium. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Entropy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Using the experiments used to discuss enthalpy the concept of entropy is developed showing that in any spontaneous change in an isolated system there is an increase in entropy. The film also shows how the National Physical Laboratory determines the entropy of a substance

results.title: Molecules at work (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Shows that most of the energy that is used by man is derived from chemical re-actions. Illustrates how chemical energy is converted to heat and how the heat is converted into work as efficiently as possible. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: The Second law of thermodynamics (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Discusses and illustrates the second law of thermodynamics which states that every system which is left to itself will, on the average, change towards a position of maximum probability. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Taperturning
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
Three methods of taper turning are demonstrated and explained. 1. Offset tailstock. 2. Adjustment of compound slide. 3. Taper turning attachment.
